column4: morning all, i have a few questions about this fresh install of ubuntu. first of all, I know I didn't do the partitions right so I need to redo it. I don't know how big to make the swap part. 120 gb hdd, I want 30 gb system, and around 90gb data. how much swap should i make?
ok, 512mb ram, so I should do around 768 mb?
well I do a lot of video editing from the camcorder, should i make a bigger swap for that?
edlin, does it hurt to have more swap than necessary? like will it slow it down? I let ubuntu figure out my partitions and it did the full 120gb in one, with about 1.5gb swap

i was going to ask about the whole root/su thing too. my last escapade with linux was fedora which uses a real "root" account. I can't su in ubuntu because it never even asked me for a root password, do I just use sudo?
